rev.desc.rev.desc: QC8467 - Attempting to use "expand array" on a Affected Ci's in Change Management - Could possibly be renamed to "Data Corruption Wizard".
Removed the panel "edit.array" of type "edit.array"
Removed the exists to the panel "edit.array" from the following panels:
- display.script.decide
Removed call to obsolete function current.window()
The following modifications were made for Employee Self Service (ESS):
1) parameter Panel
Added a parameter as input to this application. Parameter name is $INTO.OMIT.CANCEL.CONFIRMATION. Parameter type is cond.input (boolean).

If the value in this parameter is false (a NULL value is regarded to be false), then when the Back button is pressed on the script being called, the Cancel Confirmation display will not be bypassed (ie, the Cancel Confrimation WILL BE DISPLAYED). If the value in the parameter is true, then the Cancel Confirmation display will be bypassed (ie, the Cancel Confirmation will NOT be displayed).
2) Panel start
Made a modification to accept the new parameter.
3) Panel check.list.counter
Modified the first condition so that it now exits to panel decide.confirm.cancel instead of to panel cancel.
4) Panel display.script.decide
Modified the third condition ($L.action="cancel") so that it now exits to panel decide.confirm.cancel instead of to panel cancel.
5) Panel decide.confirm.cancel
New panel that determines whether or not to display the Cancel Confirmation display.
recompile only
recompile only
panels:
exec.statements and evaluate.post.statements
changed the $i and $lng variables to local variables...$L.i and $L.lng
added expression to the exec.statements panel to process any javascript. Added panels to check for post statements and post javascript and to execute any if they exist.
Case insensitivity problem fixes.
scmsg

Changed name of variable able to set from display ($L.messages) to $L.script.return.1, to show the variable as more generic than an "exit state". Requires token script.token.1 to be inserted in display.
Added support for a returned variable set in $L.messages

descript.descript: QC8467 - Attempting to use "expand array" on a Affected Ci's in Change Management - Could possibly be renamed to "Data Corruption Wizard".
Removed the panel "edit.array" of type "edit.array"
Removed the exists to the panel "edit.array" from the following panels:
- display.script.decide
Removed call to obsolete function current.window()
The following modifications were made for Employee Self Service (ESS):
1) parameter Panel
Added a parameter as input to this application. Parameter name is $INTO.OMIT.CANCEL.CONFIRMATION. Parameter type is cond.input (boolean).

If the value in this parameter is false (a NULL value is regarded to be false), then when the Back button is pressed on the script being called, the Cancel Confirmation display will not be bypassed (ie, the Cancel Confrimation WILL BE DISPLAYED). If the value in the parameter is true, then the Cancel Confirmation display will be bypassed (ie, the Cancel Confirmation will NOT be displayed).
2) Panel start
Made a modification to accept the new parameter.
3) Panel check.list.counter
Modified the first condition so that it now exits to panel decide.confirm.cancel instead of to panel cancel.
4) Panel display.script.decide
Modified the third condition ($L.action="cancel") so that it now exits to panel decide.confirm.cancel instead of to panel cancel.
5) Panel decide.confirm.cancel
New panel that determines whether or not to display the Cancel Confirmation display.
recompile only
recompile only
panels:
exec.statements and evaluate.post.statements
changed the $i and $lng variables to local variables...$L.i and $L.lng
added expression to the exec.statements panel to process any javascript. Added panels to check for post statements and post javascript and to execute any if they exist.
Case insensitivity problem fixes.
scmsg
Changed from $L.script.exit to $L.script.return.1, to show the variable as more generic than an "exit state". Requires token script.token.1 to be inserted in display.
Added support for $L.script.exit as a returned variable set in $L.messages
